intro: Guatteria psilopus, commonly known as the small-leafed guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellowish berry that contains several seeds. Guatteria psilopus is often found in shaded understory environments and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
